720102f-a.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Essex Street
720102f-a.text:
Grand Street, south side, at Essex Street. Also shown is Essex Street, at and adjoining the S.W. corner of Grand Street.
October 28, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
720102f-a.folder: Grand Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

719666f-a.title: Manhattan: Essex Street - Grand Street
719666f-a.text:
56-76 Essex Street, east side, from Grand to Broome Streets. The second house from the right is a three-story
frame with a stucco front.
June 16, 1928.
P.L. Sperr
719666f-a.folder: Essex Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720103f-a.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Essex Street
720103f-a.text:
Grand Street, north side, west from, but not including Essex Street, showing the former site of P.S. No. 137 (clearance in foreground). Also shown are Nos. 65 to 73 Ludlow Street, adjoining and no:th of the N.W. corner of Grand Street. The 4-story house at the corner faces on Grand Street and
bears No. 334.
April 4, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.
720103f-a.folder: Grand Street & Essex Street, Manhattan, NY

719664f-a.title: Manhattan: Essex Street - Grand Street
719664f-a.text:
Essex Street, east side, north from Grand Street.
February 14, 190.
P.L. Sperr.
719664f-a.folder: Essex Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

719665f-a.title: Manhattan: Essex Street - Grand Street
719665f-a.text:
Essex Street, north from and including Grand Street.
February 14, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.
719665f-a.folder: Essex Street & Grand Street, Manhattan, NY

720100f-a.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Essex Street
720100f-a.text:
348 Grand Street, north side, between Essex and Ludlow Streets, showing P.S. 137 or the Seward Park High School,
of ~anhattan.
Boerd of Education, N.Y.C.
14So

720101f-c.title: Manhattan: Grand Street - Essex Street
720101f-c.text:
.(1)
Grand Street, north side, west from Essex, to and including Ludlow
Streets. The view shows Seward Park High School.
April 20, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
Meg 454S
(2)
The same, at an earlier date, and showing demolition of the former
ubltd School No. 137 on this site.
April 1, 1928.

Broome Street.
